documents.document: @razorleaves they tend to be rewarding to listen to all the way through so I'll keep on trying the ones I haven't heard.

@razorleaves that sounds alright. I'll get onto that sometime soon.
@razorleaves never watched the original. This is some good ass television is it?

@grandpunkalex and as it turns out you read a book by the guy so I'm a bit out of my depth in the issue now. Probably worth discuss sometime

@grandpunkalex probably important to say that I don't pay very close attention to atheist issues right now because they get tiresome

@grandpunkalex the feud, I don't read that much so I don't have counter arguments to his book.
@grandpunkalex honestly didn't pay that much attention to it. But I'd be surprised if I felt that way.
@razorleaves that would be good. We haven't had that in a while.
@razorleaves yeah it'll be interesting.

Even in these shitty times, I'm not going to listen to Reza Aslan because of his religious superiority complex.

Well I've watched a lot of trash in Japanese so it's just an extension probably.
Alright yeah, I think I'm enjoying Terrace House. Me enjoying reality television, what are the odds.
@_BADCATBAD well there is being right and there is being a dick about something. Anyway thanks for your perspective.
@_BADCATBAD yep getting psychotic on someone is very concerning.
@_BADCATBAD this is all a very clear and logical policy to me. Retrospectively I was wrong in my first post, probably just feeling moody.
@_BADCATBAD presuming X person isn't shaming anyone into a relationship it seems somewhat reasonable to me for them to ask Y out. No?
@_BADCATBAD well yeah, I would hope things would be cut and dry to avoid confusion. Maybe it is only young people who aren't this confident.
@_BADCATBAD I mean to suggest more that lots of relationships with other intentions but they wouldn't say because it comes off scummy.
Anecdotally over the years I would say I agree that is a good rule of thumb. https://t.co/hVd3ZCK3Kv
